name: White Swan Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the White Swan Inn for our anniversary. I have stayed at la Petite Auberge (hotel next door owned by the same company), but it was booked up. The front desk suggested I try the White Swan and they did indeed have a room!
reviews.title: It's a great place to stay

reviews.text: We only stayed one night, but I do hope that we can return soon. We got into San Francisco late and got lost, but the great folks at the front desk guided us right to the hotel with no trouble.
reviews.title: LOVED this place!

likes.disliked: — The walk UP the hill from Union Square.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was spacious and very cozy. We had bathrobes to use and a fireplace (there is one in every room I believe). We got the valet parking added to the price of the room, and I can wholeheartedly recommend this service. They took care of the car for me and as anyone knows, parking in SF is horrible! Not to have to worry about our car was great. We let them know we needed it extra early in the morning and it was waiting for us when we needed it.
reviews.title: European charm in San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was great. Homemade breads, quiche, sausage, oatmeal, cereals, fresh fruit, coffee and tea were provided (more, I'm sure, but we couldn't try it ALL).
reviews.title: Love the chintz!

likes.liked: — Good location with spacious yet cosy room.
likes.disliked: — Service at front desk was a bit impersonal compared to other US hotels.

reviews.text: The White Swan is very close to a lot of places of interest in SF. It's a hop from Chinatown and very close to Union Square. It really is conveniently located for so many things. While I am a seasoned visitor to San Francisco, I did hear the staff giving great advice to visitors and recommending some wonderful places to visit. I asked the concierge about the history of the hotel and he was extremely knowledgeable.
reviews.title: Nice place with some fun extras!

likes.liked: — The food and beverages, cocktil hr., and aveda products.
likes.disliked: — A little far away from the action but not that bad!

reviews.text: What a charming hotel! Staff is very friendly and helpful. We booked the deluxe king room and found it very clean and spacious. The fireplace in the room was a nice treat. The hotel was built in the early 1900's and retains the original charm and character of an older building.
reviews.title: Charming hotel, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was wonderful: quiches, fresh fruits, pastries, cereal and sausages. So much more than we had expected.
reviews.title: Adorable!

reviews.text: Our room faced the street, and yes there is street noise. But, no much more than one would expect in any large city. True, there is no air conditioning, in fact very few hotels in the city do have a/c. But with the mild climate of San Francisco, it is almost never needed. Parking is off site, so there is a bit of a wait for your car to be brought around if you need it immediately. But, with a little planning ahead, its a non-issue.
reviews.title: Very Nice--BUT (!!) Quality Control and Attention to Detail Needed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to do some shopping the day of our departure and the hotel stored our luggage for us until we returned. We called ahead for our car and it was waiting for us when we returned. The hotel is within walking distance to many great restaurants, shopping and the cable car lines. We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Great Inn, Great Location, Great Service...

likes.liked: — The cozy feel of the Inn

reviews.text: Hotel was quaint, staff friendly, complimentary breakfast delicious. I can't wait to stay here again!
reviews.title: Excellent boutique hotel
France in San Francisco
reviews.text: I needed a place to stay while work was done in my home. I am an SF resident, so I needed a place to replicate home, I work at home. I have been staying at all the big local 4 & 5 star hotels and found their huge machine-like operations distasteful. We were paying club rate and being treated like children! In one a printed sheet informs one how to dress for their breakfast – (basically a Denny’s meal), told not to take food out of the room and you are watched on cameras. We were paying a high club rate for being treated like escapees from Miss Manner’s prison. But those hotels are clean and have all the amenities we need – Internet, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was at first not too sure about staying at a small B&B type place. The rate was good, and the pictures looked cute, so I decided to experiment. Usually online photos are better then the truth. You cannot smell mustiness online.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in SF

likes.disliked: — Not enough counter space in the bathroom.

reviews.text: I arrived expecting the worst to be honest. The outside is nothing spectacular – just as I found in Europe. Exteriors can be deceiving. The sweetest desk person – mouth full of braces revealing the most gorgeous smile – was more then accommodating. “You need more body lotion – we’ll send it up. Movie schedule – let me print it out for you.” There was not that rushed tone of patronizing fake care. I loved the whole hotel – it is an escape into a Victorian world - it is so much like European Inns, but CLEAN, no mold or mustiness. The room we stayed in was spotless. Had a hard time finding the switch to turn on the fireplace – but again, there was no blown out gasp of condescension when I called down to inquire where in the room it might be hiding. The snack – uh wine and cheese, grapes, etc – was sweet – good way to mingle. But the breakfast was beyond what I expected. The quiche is homemade – I really was ready for it to be a Costco kind’ve scene – something made with lard and gelatin. It was light and full of veggies.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was fruit, juice, and a huge yummy pot of oatmeal. Great homemade scones and yummies. When I asked one of the serving ladies were these warmed muffins made there, she had the very slightly affronted response that comes from someone carrying the pride of their work – “Of course!” I was thrilled.
reviews.title: Outstanging

likes.liked: — The large rooms and the clean facility
likes.disliked: — Front desk personel not always there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cleaning people in the halls all smiled – I am not kidding. When I approached them for a few more plastic bags – they offered me more water.
reviews.title: Loved the quaint hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The description of this darling hotel by the hotel is entirely accurate. It is a cozy, comfortable place to stay. Our room was generously sized but felt more like a bedroom in a home than a cookie-cutter hotel room. The bathroom was more than adequate, and the dressing room was a luxury. Breakfast was excellent. Easy location. Affordable valet parking was a great benefit. Everything that the hotel promised was truth. In this way, White Swan met all expecations. What made it exceed expectations was the caliber of the staff.
reviews.title: A Real Charmer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just loved our stay at the White Swan Inn. We enjoyed our room with plenty of space and comfortable furniture--and a working fireplace. It was very homey. The bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: What a great find in SanFrancisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wine and cheese hour gave us an opportunity to mingle with the other guests and was most pleaant.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay

likes.liked: — The extras (free sodas, wine and cheese etc)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast each day were reallyexcellent--a hot dish, fruit, pastries, cereal and muffins. Excellent.
reviews.title: A hidden gem in the Bay Area

likes.disliked: — No free Wireless Internet (Had to find something I didn't like)

reviews.title: Very Relaxing and Accomodating-Nice Atmosphere
reviews.text: The room was very clean. My only small complaint was the bathroom--spolessly clean, but could use a little updating. However considering that this building was quite old, they have done a wonderful rehab job.

description: With a crackling fireplace in all 26 guestrooms and suites, the White Swan Inn is a romantic small hotel in the Nob Hill/Union Square area. The White Swan Inn is a visually stunning tribute to the intimate hotels of London. Dark wood paneling, rich floral carpets, comfortable furniture and enchanting English art and collectables set the tone. All guests enjoy a generous breakfast buffet and evening wine and hors d'oeuvres served fireside in the parlor.
